discussion.p: Monotonic clocks are generally easy to provide on all systems and are implicitely required by some of the library facilities anyway.
discussion.blockquote: Paper n3128 addresses this issue by replacing monotonic_clock with steady_clock, which is mandatory.
discussion.p: This is resolved by adopting n3191. The original resolution is preserved for reference:

blockquote.del: The class monotonic_clock is conditionally supported.

blockquote.blockquote: The member functions whose names end in _for take an argument that specifies a relative time. Implementations should use a monotonic clock to measure time for these functions. [ Note: Implementations are not required to use a monotonic clock because such a clock may not be available. — end note ]
